title: Simon Helberg lands first big post-Big Bang Theory role in new musical
text:
Howard – sorry, Simon – is heading to Amazon (Picture: Kevin Winter/Getty Images for The Critics’ Choice Awards)

Simon Helberg is leaving Howard Wolowitz behind to take the plunge into the world of musicals.

The Big Bang Theory actor has taken a well-deserved break since the long-running sitcom came to an end earlier this year, but he’s now landed his next role – and it’s in a new musical film from Amazon Studios.

Annette, which is being directed by celebrated French filmmaker Leos Carax, already boasts Adam Driver and Marion Cotillard on its cast list, with the two stars playing a pair of star-crossed lovers.

Driver will play a stand-up comedian, while Cotillard’s character is a modern opera star – and, yes, both stars will be doing their own singing in the movie.

Adam loves a warble (Picture: Vittorio Zunino Celotto/Getty Images)

Helberg, who rose to fame playing physicist Howard on The Big Bang Theory, will play a character who simply goes by the name ‘The Conductor’, according to Deadline.

Shooting is currently underway on Annette in LA, with California duo Sparks – made up of brothers Ron Mael and Russell Mael – driving the movie.

The band devised the story, wrote the script and have penned a set of original songs with music producer Marius de Vries, who previously worked on La La Land, Bohemian Rhapsody and Moulin Rouge.

The music we’ll hear in the film was originally set to be a Sparks album, but it’s now being used as the soundtrack to Annette.

Annette is set for release on Amazon in 2020.
